text: A dense forest on a dark, misty night. YOUNG EDWARD CARNBY (age 10), small, thin, and terrified, runs for his life. 2 The forest is pitch black. Young Edward ducks between tre under branches, not stopping for anything, GASPING for breath. He doesn't turn to look behind him. He just runs fast as he can.

Tomething chases Young Edward through the dark forest. It P.O.V. is skewed, inhuman. It is gaining on him. As Young Edward runs, beams of light become visible throu the closely packed trees. Something is up ahead, somethin bright. Edward runs towards it. Young Edward bursts out into a clearing in the woods, run towards the bright light.
The light stops whatever is chasing Young Edward at the e of the forest. What is making the light isn't visible, on Young Edward's silhouette running towards the blinding li

The beams of a dozen flashlights cut through the mist of dark forest. A dozen uniformed DEPUTIES move through the forest, shini their flashlights around, searching. The trees tower over them. A low fog hangs in the air. Th flashlight beams can barely penetrate it.
A large and stately old house stands on the edge of town. small, dense forest stretches out behind it. The sign on the front reads: OUR LADY OF PERPETUAL LIGHT ORPHANAGE.

Several patrol cars are parked along the Orphanage's grav driveway. DEPUTIES mill around the front lawn. Another patrol car pulls up. Out of it steps the SHERIFF (late 40s). DEPUTY ADAMS (mid-30s) approaches him.
What's going on, Adams?
Twenty kids live at this orphanage, Sheriff. All twenty have gone missing.
SISTER CLARA (mid-40s), an anxious-looking nun, stands on front porch, wrapped in a shawl. She speaks with two DEPUTIES. The Sheriff walks up and listens in.
After the power went out, I went to check on the children. But their beds were empty. Every one of them. They just disappeared...

3 The Deputies sweep through the forest with their flashlig The trees are close together, blocking out the moonlight. thick mist hangs in the trees. As Deputy Adams moves through the forest, he sees a brigh light streaming through the trees up ahead.
Deputy Adams comes through the trees and emerges into a clearing in the woods. He sees a Shed in the clearing up ahead. A bright light i posted over the Shed's front entrance. 4
Deputy Adams shines his flashlight around the outside of Shed. He sees that the door is open just a crack. On the door i sign marked: DANGER, along with the symbol for ELECTRICIT
5 Deputy Adams enters the Shed.

The Shed is small, packed with electrical equipment, powe cables, and various implements for repairing power lines. Deputy Adams sweeps through the Shed with his flashlight. He approaches a large transformer module that sits at the back of the Shed. It HUMS and CRACKLES with electricity. There's a LOW SHUFFLING sound. Deputy Adams stops. He carefully peers around behind the transformer. The spa is too small for a full-size person. But sitting on the ground behind the transformer is Young Edward. He clutches himself, shivering, frightened.
6 The Sheriff stands with his Deputies. His walkie-talkie CRACKLES to life.
Sheriff! I found one! White, male, about ten years old. Looks to be unharmed. He's in a utility shed maybe half a mile from the orphanage.

7 Deputy Adams approaches Young Edward. He takes off his ja and wraps it around Young Edward's shoulders. Young Edward pulls the jacket around him and smiles, stil scared, but happy to see the Deputy.
Are you okay, son? Are the other kids around here?
I don't know... I don't remember...
Why don't we start with your name? Do you remember your name?
Edward... Edward Carnby.

EDWARD CARNBY (early 30s), lean and intense, wakes up. He quickly looks around to get his bearings. He sits in a large commercial airplane. The compartment i full of seated PASSENGERS. SMALL BOY (age 8) sits next to Carnby, looking up at him. The Small Boy's MOTHER (early 40s) sleeps next to him.
Did you have a nightmare?
Carnby looks at the Small Boy, curious. He doesn't respon
You ate cheese with dinner. My mommy says cheese gives you nightmares. Want to see my coloring book?
The Small Boy has a Halloween-themed coloring book open o his lap. It's a graveyard scene, full of cartoon drawings ghosts, werewolves, and vampires.
I think there's a vampire living in my closet, but my mommy says vampires and ghosts aren't real. She says there's nothing to be afraid of in the dark.
Carnby weighs what he's going to say.
Your mother is wrong. Being afraid of the dark is what keeps most of us alive.
The Small Boy's eyes open wide.
Everybody else tells me not to be afraid.
That's because they don't know the truth.
13 Carnby exits the Terminal and heads over to a row of taxi waiting outside the Terminal. He doesn't carry a suitcase

So, maybe you're thinking I'm an asshole, trying to scare this poor kid for no reason. But that's where you're wrong. Because I've got my reasons. There's a world around you that you've trained yourself not to see. You've willfully closed your eyes. But your fear of the dark is not a weakness. It's there to protect you from things you'd better pray you never see. My eyes were forced open a long time ago. Now I know. Just because you can't see something, doesn't mean it can't kill you.
Carnby steps into the first taxi waiting in the row. The shifts into gear and drives off. Another taxi is parked up ahead. As Carnby's taxi passes the second taxi pulls out and follows it.

Behind the wheel of the taxi sits JAMES PINKERTON (early 50s). His face is drawn, grim. He wears dark sunglasses. The DRIVER lies dead in the backseat of Pinkerton's taxi. Carnby's taxi can be seen through the front windshield, driving up ahead.
The two taxis drive through traffic. Pinkerton's taxi lag few cars back, but matches Carnby's taxi move for move.

The CABBIE (late 20s), manic bordering on crazy, steers through traffic. Carnby rides in the backseat. He looks out the back windshield. A few cars back, Pinkerton's taxi follows the Carnby takes a burlap sack out of his trench-coat pocket. Inside the sack is a stone carving of a demonic-looking h
The edges are soft, worn-down, the detail roughed away. B it is clearly not a human face. Carnby puts the carving back in his trench-coat pocket.
You travel light.
Trust me, I'm carrying enough baggage for the both of us.
The Cabbie CHUCKLES as he steers through traffic.
That's pretty funny, man. What do you do?
You really want to know?
Yeah, man. Hearing about my passengers' lives keeps the job interesting.
I'm a paranormal investigator.
Get the fuck outta here!
Beat.
What does that mean exactly?
I'm an effective solution to unusual problems.
Carnby turns to look out the back windshield. Pinkerton's taxi is still following from a few cars back.
Speaking of which, that taxi's been following us since the airport.
No shit? Want me to lose him?
If you can...
The Cabbie GUNS the motor and speeds off.

Carnby's taxi accelerates down the street, pulling away f Pinkerton's taxi. As soon as it's evident that they are on to him, Pinkerto taxi speeds up to give chase. The two taxis rocket down the streets, swerving past cars SCREECHING around corners. Carnby's taxi speeds down the streets, narrowly avoiding collisions with other cars and PEDESTRIANS. Pinkerton just plows through whatever's in his way, SMASH past other cars, forcing Pedestrians to jump out of the w Pinkerton accelerates and tries to force Carnby's taxi of the road. The taxi's GRIND against one another. Carnby's taxi SCREECHES around a corner, speeding into a street that leads to the Market Street.

A busy street crowded with PEDESTRIANS, open shops, and produce stalls. Carnby's taxi races down the busy Market Street, followed Pinkerton. They swerve and SCREECH down the Street, cutting off othe cars, and narrowly avoiding Pedestrians. But then Pinkerton's taxi ZOOMS up beside Carnby's taxi a BUMPS into it with a GRINDING CRUSH of metal. Not stopping, Pinkerton's taxi continues to GRIND into Carnby's taxi. The momentum pushes Carnby's taxi around sideways. Pinkerton's taxi then SLAMS Carnby's sideways taxi into a parked car with a CRUSH of metal and SHATTERING glass. There's a moment as Carnby, trapped inside the CRUSHED ta and Pinkerton, flooring the accelerator to add more press exchange a look. Pinkerton's expression is fierce. Pinkerton gears the taxi into reverse, backing up in orde smash into Carnby's taxi again. The Cabbie is trapped by the crushed front of the taxi. H face is covered with a spiderweb of deep cuts. The Cabbie struggles to get loose.
I'm trapped, man!
I'll draw him away...

As Pinkerton's taxi backs up, it CRASHES into a Van drivi by, knocking it over onto its side and spilling the conte of the Van onto the street. This gives Carnby the brief moment he needs to extract himself from the crushed taxi. He wrenches himself out th window, just in time to see Pinkerton's taxi accelerating towards him. Carnby bolts away from the crushed taxi and the trapped Cabbie. Pinkerton immediately swerves his taxi, aiming it right f the running Carnby. Pinkerton's taxi rockets towards him.

Carnby leaps out of the way as Pinkerton's taxi CRASHES i the side of a Building, narrowly missing him. Pinkerton's taxi is CRUMPLED in a CRASH of metal and glass. Carnby narrowly avoids being crushed between the taxi and building. With fluid grace, Carnby rolls to safety, landi on his feet. With a quick look back over his shoulder at Pinkerton in his crumpled taxi, Carnby runs. Pinkerton steps out of his taxi, seemingly unhurt by the crash. He looks around, but can't see Carnby anywhere on street. Pinkerton runs for an iron-wrought staircase that leads u a Pedestrian Bridge that hangs over the Street. At the top of the Pedestrian Bridge, Pinkerton looks up a down the street. He spots Carnby, running through the crowd of Pedestrians Pinkerton leaps off the Pedestrian Bridge, arcing through air with superhuman force. Pinkerton TACKLES the running Carnby to the ground, SLAMM into him with a tremendous impact. But Carnby is quick. He takes the hit and spins Pinkerton around with a martial-arts kick. The kick sends Pinkerton CRASHING through the front window of a Bakery.
Pinkerton comes CRASHING through the display window, land in a pile of sticky buns and broken glass. But seemingly unfazed, he just picks himself up and walks back out the front door.

Carnby stands in a crowd of BYSTANDERS, watching in surpr as Pinkerton exits the Bakery, his expression fierce. Pinkerton immediately spots Carnby and comes after him. Carnby bolts away, running into a Herbalist Store across street.

Jars of different shapes and sizes containing a variety o medicinal herbs and other such substances are on display. Carnby runs into the Herbalist Store, making his way thro the displays. Pinkerton leaps right through the Herbalist Store's front display window in a hail of SHATTERED glass. He tackles Carnby, CRASHING through the jars on display. Pinkerton SLAMS Carnby to the ground. He grabs Carnby's h and SMASHES it against the floor once, then twice. Pinkerton tears open Carnby's trench-coat. He pulls out t burlap sack. He opens the sack, confirming the stone carv is inside it. While Pinkerton inspects the stone carving, Carnby's hand quietly moves to a large glass jar lying next to them. Carnby SMASHES the glass jar over Pinkerton's face. He grabs the stone carving out of Pinkerton's hand, scram to his feet, and runs.

Carnby BURSTS out of the Herbalist Store's back door, exi out into a small, cluttered Alley. Carnby lands hard in the debris, but he rolls with the fa and is back up on his feet, running. The Alley ends in a high Wall with a Billboard on top of The Wall has a railing along one side. Carnby vaults over the railing and keeps running. The Alley is crowded with WORKERS unloading crates out of loading dock of the Ice Factory. A BEAT COP walks by. Carnby runs past the Beat Cop, just barely bumping into him. But as Carnby passes him, he deftly grabs the Beat Cop's from his holster. The Beat Cop doesn't even notice his gun is missing as he turns, annoyed to see Carnby racing away.
Hey!

Pinkerton runs out of the Herbalist Store's back door. He runs directly at the high Wall. Pinkerton leaps up, scrambling right up the side of the W He hauls himself up the Billboard, until he's standing at top of the Billboard itself. Pinkerton looks down below and spots Carnby running into loading dock of the Ice Factory. Pinkerton leaps off the Billboard. The Beat Cop looks up, stunned to see Pinkerton leaping towards him. Pinkerton lands on top of a moving dolly of crates, CRUSH the crates on it. The WORKER pushing the dolly falls back shocked. Pinkerton leaps off the dolly and keeps chasing after Carnby. The Beat Cop fumbles for his gun. It's not there. Pinkert smashes the Beat Cop out of the way as he pursues Carnby. The Beat Cop flies into a pile of crates, knocked out. Pinkerton follows Carnby into the Ice Factory.

The refrigerated Ice Factory is filled with neat rows of blocks. FACTORY WORKERS mill about, transporting the bloc of ice through the Factory. Carnby hides between the rows of ice blocks. He checks th Beat Cop's gun to make sure it's loaded. It is. Carnby stops, sensing something. In one fluid motion, Carnby suddenly spins, turning in th other direction and FIRING the gun. We follow the bullet as it rockets through the Ice Factor It WHIZZES along, until we see Carnby's intended target. Pinkerton comes through the Ice Factory, running at Carnb The bullet flies directly at him. The bullet hits Pinkerton in the shoulder. But it only se to anger Pinkerton further. He keeps running at Carnby.

Pinkerton leaps at Carnby. Carnby FIRES again. But Pinker dodges the bullet and it hits a block of ice, SHATTERING in a hail of ice shards. Pinkerton rolls with his dodge and races off into the sta of ice blocks. Carnby tries to track Pinkerton's movements through the i stacks. He hears the sound of Pinkerton MOVING, but can't him. His gun is ready. He searches around. Suddenly, there's a RUSH of movement behind him. Carnby dodges just as Pinkerton's fist comes flying out. Pinkert connects with an ice block, SHATTERING it. Carnby is backed into a dead end in the Ice Factory. He t to face Pinkerton, gun ready. But Pinkerton is on him too quickly. He lunges at Carnby, hoisting him over his head and SLAMMING him down on a conveyer belt. Pinkerton drags Carnby along the conveyer belt. But Carnb grabs a hanging chain to steady himself. With a quick kic Carnby uses the momentum to flip Pinkerton over him. Pinkerton flies through the air towards a large ice pick wedged into the wall. The sharp point of the ice pick pun right through Pinkerton's torso, impaling him. He is immediately killed. Carnby leans up against the wall, steadying himself. He p the stone carving out of his pocket to check it. In the fight, the carving has been cracked into pieces. But the broken carving reveals something hidden inside it small gold artifact that was concealed in the carving. The artifact is a gold circle, flat on the top and bottom its thick round side engraved with intricate Abkani symbo This is the lynchpin artifact, the piece which connects t other artifacts together.

17 The elegant Museum of Natural History. A wide staircase l up to an entranceway surrounded by stone pillars. Over the front of the Museum hangs a large banner reading "SECRETS OF THE ANCIENT ABKANI  COMING SOON".

18 The high-ceilinged Main Hall of the Museum. Glass display cases are set up to showcase archeological artifacts. ALINE CEDRAC (late 20s), studious but dynamic, stands in front of a display case. She carries a clipboard. A heavy-set GUARD (early 50s) approaches, followed by a DELIVERY GUY (late 20s), who hauls in a crate on a dolly.
Got another delivery, Ms. Cedrac.
Aline checks her clipboard.
I don't have anything scheduled. What museum was it transferred from?
The Delivery Guy reads the information on his clipboard.
For Dr. Hudgens, from Dr. Hudgens.
It's probably an error. It must be for the big Abkani show.
Abkani? What the hell's Abkani?
Ancient Native American civilization. They were this super-advanced culture, but something like ten thousand years ago, they just disappeared.
You've been reading up.
Not much else to do around here at night.
Aline picks up a crowbar and approaches the crate.
Says here it's not to be opened by anyone but Dr. Hudgens.
This is Aline Cedrac. She's the assistant curator.
We've got Abkani artifacts coming in from museums around the world. Until Hudgens gets back, I'm doing all the cataloguing anyway.
Aline pries open the lid of the crate with the crow-bar. of the packing foam, Aline lifts up a heavy stone tablet carved with elaborate Abkani symbols. Aline holds it up, fascinated.
Where is Hudgens anyway? The show opens in a few days.
Off on another archeological goosechase. He thinks he's finally found the Erebus.
So he sticks you with the work. At least it keeps your mind off your boyfriend.
Aline pleasant expression suddenly turns awkward.
I'll be in my office if you need me.
Aline quickly walks off, taking the stone tablet with her
What was that all about?
Damn it... I shouldn't have said that. Her boyfriend's been missing for the last three months.
Delivery Guy shakes his head at the Guard.
Nice going, jack-ass.
19 A large Ship out on the open sea.

CREWMEN scurry around the deck attending to a huge crane hangs over the side of the Ship. Chains leads from the cr into the water. DR. LIONEL HUDGENS (mid-60s), wiry and severe with a shar intelligence, stands on the deck with CAPTAIN CHERNICK (l 40s). They look down at the water.
They say a sunken ship is like a grave. It should never be disturbed.
I've been searching for the Erebus for twenty years, Captain. Now that I've found it, I'm afraid your ill-informed superstitions aren't enough to stop me.
20 Two DIVERS in high-tech Newt Suits break the surface. The signal to Captain Chernick.
1 Hudgens nods to Captain Chernick.
Bring it up.

Captain Chernick signals to his Crewmen. The crane is engaged. The chains run through the mechanis the crane, pulling something to the surface. The crane GROANS under the weight. Captain Chernick looks nervous as the crane SHUDDERS with the strain.
22 Out of the ocean, the crane raises a large, heavy contain The container is about eight feet long. It is battered an damaged by the ocean water, and covered in barnacles.
23 Carnby unlocks the multiple locks on the front door to hi Loft and enters.
As Carnby walks through the Loft, he passes his answering machine. The MESSAGES indicator blinks. Carnby presses th button to retrieve his messages.

Edward, John here. Hope things went well wherever you were this time. And, please, do not, I repeat, do not tell me about it. Every time you tell me about your latest case, I get nightmares for a week. Anyway, give me a call when you get back. Linda wants to have you by for dinner. Lord knows why, but she seems to like you. And if you haven't scared Aline away yet, bring her along.

The Loft is a large, incredibly cool-looking space. In one corner is a lab area filled with high-tech scienti equipment. At another work station, dozens of drawings, m and photos are spread out next to a flat-screen computer. few photos are tacked to a corkboard. Several bookshelves, all crammed with books, line one wal old framed photograph sits on a bookshelf, a faded photo twenty CHILDREN sitting on the front steps of the Orphana Sister Clara stands with them. Young Edward sits to one s A weapons cabinet features racks lined with guns and blad weapons. In another corner is a work-out area. The sleek, modern kitchen and living quarters are in anot corner. The bed is set up against a wall of large windows Outside the windows, the sun is setting. Approaching the lab area, Carnby takes out the lynchpin artifact. He turns it around in his fingers, watching the light glint off it.

24 The Ship is docked at a mist-enshrouded pier. Overhead li along the dock illuminate the area. A transport truck is parked on the Dock just next to the Ship's loading ramp. In front of the ramp, five CREWMEN with automatic weapons stand guard, smoking and looking vigilant.

26 Standing on the Ship's wide deck, Captain Chernick looks impatient. Hudgens stands over the large, barnacle-covere container. The container is secured with a heavy rusted l Two large, muscular men, the FIRST MATE and CREWMAN BARNE check the chains connecting the container to the huge cra on the deck. They are preparing to load it onto the truck the Dock.
Don't you want to open it? Make sure it's what you're looking for?
The conditions must be perfect. Otherwise, there will be... consequences.

Captain Chernick steps up to the barnacle-covered contain He notices that a section of the barnacles have gotten scraped off in the transport. Under the barnacles, the container is revealed to made of gold. Chernick look startled. Captain Chernick rubs the gold spot on the container and looks closely at it.
Is this made of solid gold?

Did you know the Abkani were the first civilization to use gold for their valuables? They believed it held the power to contain evil spirits. Thousands of years later, we don't even remember why gold was valuable to us in the first place. Now, let's load it onto the truck.
Captain Chernick exchanges a look with the First Mate and Crewman Barnes. They both give him a subtle nod.

Carnby sits in his lab area, studying the lynchpin artifa under an illuminated magnifying lamp. The computer runs an analysis of the symbols carved into artifact. The symbols flash by. The computer BEEPS, ready has isolated the origins of the symbols. They are ABKANI.
Carnby looks over at a photo tacked to the corkboard next the work station. The photo is of Carnby and Aline.

The Office is cluttered with books, maps, diagrams, and strange artifacts. Along one wall are several ceiling-hig shelving units, each containing rows of drawers. The draw hold artifacts from the Museum's collection. Aline inspects the stone tablet. She speaks into a tape recorder, like a coroner recording an autopsy.

The pictograms are late-period Abkani. It seems to be some sort of... prophecy. Shadows that make ghosts of men. The world of light consumed by darkness. This is the first indication I've ever seen that the Abkani had a myth about the end of the world.
Captain Chernick approaches Hudgens at the container. The First Mate and Crewman Barnes stand quietly behind them.
If the container's made of gold, whatever's inside must be worth a fortune.
You have no idea...
Chernick pulls out a pistol.
But I'm looking forward to finding out.
Chernick smacks Hudgens across the face with his pistol. Hudgens gives Chernick a grim look.
I suppose one should not be surprised when mercenaries act mercenary.

rewman Barnes grabs Hudgens and twists his arms behind hi back, incapacitating him. The First Mate pulls out a revo and points it right at Hudgens' face. Captain Chernick wedges a crowbar into the container's lo
You're making a terrible mistake.
The only mistake would be letting you walk out with whatever's in there. Barnes...
Crewman Barnes SMASHES Hudgens' head against the containe Hudgens is dazed from the blow.
Throw him in there.

Crewman Barnes throws the dazed Hudgens into a Storage Ro built onto the Deck. He slams the thick metal door closed The door has a small, glass-covered peephole built into i Chernick pries open the lock with the crowbar. Chernick h the First Mate the crowbar and he jams it into the handle the door, wedging it closed.
27 Hudgens struggles to his feet. He BANGS on the door, tryi to pull it open.
Captain! Don't open it!
28 The First Mate and Crewman Barnes watch in fasciation as Captain Chernick prepares to open the gold container.
Let's see what all the fuss is about...
He opens the container. With a deep SIGH, the vacuum of dry air escapes.

9 Carnby sits in front of his computer. He scans through screens of information relating to Abkani civilization. Carnby suddenly winces in intense pain. He clutches his h staggering to his feet. He knocks over a desk lamp and a chair as he stumbles back.
Grabbing his head and trying to shake off the pain, Carnb collapses unconscious to the floor. He is out cold. On the work station, the lynchpin artifact starts to glow

30 JOHN HOUGHTON (early 30s) lies asleep in his bed next to wife, LINDA HOUGHTON (early 30s). Suddenly, John opens his eyes. John quietly sits up and gets out of bed. Linda is woken but just barely. John walks out of the room.
John?
Linda rolls over and falls back asleep.
1 John exits the house. He walks down the front path and ou into the night.
32 Carnby lies unconscious on the floor. The lynchpin artifact glows brightly, emitting a LOW HUM. 3
A low wind wafts through the Main Hall. Air flows through the space, swirling dust along the floo banner hanging from the ceiling ripples from the breeze.

34 Aline sits at her desk, her back to the shelving units. S inspects the stone tablet and takes notes. In one of the shelving units, a faint glow emanates out o closed drawers. Something in another drawer begins glowing. Then the cont of a third drawer start to glow.

Out of the three drawers, a LOW HUM is emitted. Aline loo up, tilting her head to hear the LOW HUMMING. She turns around to face the shelving units. She is surpr to see the strange glow coming out of the three drawers. She cautiously approaches the shelving units. She reaches hand out to open the first glowing drawer.
36 As the First Mate and Crewman Barnes watch in anticipatio Captain Chernick opens the gold container all the way. The container is empty. The lights along the Deck start to flicker.
37 The lights in the Storage Room start to flicker on and of Hudgens looks up at the lights.
They're faster than I thought...
39 he lights continue to flicker. Captain Chernick turns to Storage Room door. He looks back at the First Mate and Crewman Barnes.
Kill him.

The First Mate and Crewman Barnes pull out revolvers. The approach the Storage Room door. There's a WHOOSH of movement behind them. The three men a turn, surprised. But nothing is there. Suddenly, Captain Chernick is thrown back by something invisible. He is hoisted into the air. He looks shocked. Captain Chernick seems to be floating just above the grou although it is clear something invisible is holding him u

The First Mate and Crewman Barnes look on, stunned, their revolvers aimed at the floating Captain. Captain Chernick's body contorts, as if something had bee thrust into it. With a burst of blood, a hole is ripped i his torso, killing him. Captain Chernick's lifeless body is dropped to the ground Terrified, the First Mate and Crewman Barnes aim their 4    revolvers at the empty air. They OPEN FIRE.

0 Hudgens stands at the door, listening to the GUNFIRE. He looks through the peephole in the door. The peephole i dirty, hard to see through. Something frantic is happenin outside the door, but it's hard to see exactly what. There is more GUNFIRE and then SCREAMING. Short BURSTS of AUTOMATIC GUNFIRE follow, and more SCREAMING. And then, all is quiet. Hudgens grabs a discarded metal rod and jams it into the handle, wedging it closed. He backs away from the door. T only weapon he can see is a box-cutter. He grabs it, hold it out in front of him. Suddenly, there's a CRASH at the door. Something pushes a the door, trying to get in. The door RATTLES and THUMPS f the impact. Hudgens, still holding the box-cutter, strains against th door, using all the effort he can muster to keep it shut. metal rod wedged against the door is starting to buckle. Suddenly, the door is still. Hudgens waits. Nothing. There's a CRASH as another impact hits the door. The RACK is even more intense. But the door holds. Finally, the thrashing stops. All is quiet again. The lights in the Storage Room stop flickering. They come back on. Hudgens listens, straining to hear anything at a Cautious, Hudgens pulls away the metal rod. He gingerly touches the door. With a long CREAK, it slowly swings ope The crowbar was shaken loose from all the impacts.

Hudgens steps out of the Storage Room. He looks around th Deck. Mist blows in off the water. The night is quiet. Bodies lie everywhere, Captain Chernick, the First Mate, Crewman Barnes, the other Crewmen. Their weapons lie next their slashed, ripped open bodies. Bullet holes are pocked around the Deck. Streaks of blood smeared everywhere. Shell casings and corpses are all tha remain of the battle. Tense, carefully looking around, Hudgens walks up to the empty gold container. He reaches into it, pressing a concealed panel at the bac the container. The panel opens, revealing a small artifact. The artifact a thin hollow cylinder with a thick little protrusion on end. It is covered in Abkani symbols. Hudgens takes out the artifact. He turns it around in his hand. He looks pleased.

48 Everything in Bureau 713's Headquarters looks sleek and h tech. There are no windows anywhere. COMMANDER BURKE (late 30s) strides purposefully down the hallway. He is confident to the point of arrogance. His second-in-command, AGENT MILES (mid-30s), driven and efficient, hurries to keep up.
his better be good, Miles.
Sir, we're getting some strange readings in the control room.
his is Bureau 713. "Strange" doesn't even crack my radar. Now what's the situation?
Well, sir, normal levels of paranormal activity range from three to five...
condescending) Yes Miles. And what level are the sensors picking up now?
Burke and Miles arrive at the Control Room. Burke nods to BUREAU GUARDS standing at the entrance.
We don't know.
Burke stops and looks at Agent Miles for the first time.
They only go up to 50.
Agent Miles opens the door to the Control Room. 4

9 Inside the Control Room, the banks of monitors and sensor are all lit up. Streams of data flow across the monitors. Burke and Miles stand at the doorway. AGENT "KRASH" KRASHINSKY (mid-30s), a cool and collected female tech-geek, scans through data on the monitors. She always wears a headset.
What are we looking at, Krashinsky?
Electromagnetics off the scale, Commander.
AGENT YONEK, a Control Room techie, adjusts the sensors.
Recalibrating sensors now, sir.
Burke looks concerned for the first time.

50 Young Edward (age 10) walks through the Den. The lights a all out. The Den is musty, but clean. A sliver of light glows from underneath the doorway to Si Clara's bedroom. Young Edward KNOCKS softly on the door. Sister Clara opens the door. She wears her nightgown.
Still having trouble sleeping, Edward? You can't stay up all night, you know.
Sister, something's happened.
What is it, Edward?
They're not gone anymore. The others are back.

3 Sister Clara throws open the door to one of the children' bedrooms. Ten beds are lined up along the wall. All ten o them have CHILDREN asleep in them. Sister Clara GASPS, holding her hand to her mouth.
54 Carnby lurches awake. He is still lying on the floor. His cellphone is RINGING. Carnby gets to his feet, rubbin his temples, trying to get his bearings. He answers his c
(groggy) Hello?
Edward, thank god!
Linda, what's wrong?
(hysterical) It's John. I woke up and... he's just gone. All his clothes are here. His car's in the garage. It's like he just got up in the middle of the night and walked out.

Hudgens stops at a work station and pauses. A look of pai crosses his face. He winces, holding it in. He steadies himself. At the other side of the Lab is a large recess in the spa The opening is covered by thick cage bars covered in gold The cage appears to be empty. But suddenly, an invisible creature SLAMS into the bars o the cage, trying to lunge at Hudgens. As it hits the bars, fingers of electricity jolt through making it visible for a split second. Hudgens watches calmly. He goes to a small dial built int the wall beside the cage. Hudgens turns up the dial. In the cage, jagged bolts of electricity jolt around the invisible creature. It SQUEALS and HISSES from the electricity.

Finally, the creature collapses and fades visible. The creature is unconscious, but still alive. Hudgens turns the dial back down. Hudgens picks up a hypodermic syringe from a counter next the cage. He injects the syringe into the creature's neck, between of its scales. He withdraws a syringe-full of the creatur black, sticky blood. He goes back to the work station, rolling up the sleeve o his shirt. His arm is pocked with injection marks. Hudgens ties off his arm, preps a vein, and injects himse with the syringe of creature's blood. He closes his eyes, feeling the substance flow into him.

117 Aline walks up to an imposing, slightly decrepit-looking brick building in a bad area of town. She goes to press the buzzer, but the box is broken, the wires limply hanging out. She KNOCKS on the door. No answer. She stops, annoyed. But then a slight, involuntary smile comes across her face. Aline fishes in her purse and pulls out a set of keys. Sh finds the key she's looking for and slips it into the loc the front door. She pauses for a moment, then turns the key.
119 Aline enters the Loft. She looks around.
Edward?
Aline closes the door behind her. She takes another few s into the Loft.
She spots Carnby's discarded trench-coat on the floor. Sh walks up and picks it up with two fingers.
I see nothing's changed...
Aline hangs the coat on a hook. She enters the Loft prope looking around.
Edward?

Aline stops. She sees Carnby lying on his bed, asleep. Sh smiles. He looks peaceful. Aline sees the lynchpin artifact sitting in the lab area. unpacks her bag, taking out three items wrapped in cloth. places the three items next to the lynchpin artifact. She looks over at Carnby, sleeping in his bed. Aline kicks off her shoes and walks over to the bed. She climbs onto the bed, careful not to disturb Carnby. H stirs a little, but he doesn't wake up. Aline lies down n to Carnby on the bed. She notices the new scars and bruis along his back. Aline lays her head on a pillow. Their faces lie close together. She watches Carnby sleep. Aline leans over and gives Carnby the lightest of kisses. doesn't wake up.
Sweet dreams...
Aline's eyes flutter closed, then open, then closed again Within seconds, she's asleep.
Burke stands behind Krash at the monitor banks, surveying incoming information.
Agent Miles holds the door open as Fischer enters. Miles stands at the door, listening. Burke doesn't face Fischer
Have you been meeting with Carnby?
Yes. He's got intell we need. And I trust him.
Burke turns around to face Fischer.
We've got to trust each other, Fischer. Are you with us or not?
Fischer weighs his answer.
What do you need from me?
All the intell you've got on Edward Carnby.

The Kitchen is comfortable, lived in. Fischer's suit jack hangs on the back of a chair. His revolver and holster al hang on the chair. Fischer's wife, SARAH FISCHER (early 50s) stirs the conte of a pot with a wooden spoon. Fischer makes a salad.
What else could I do? I had to tell him.
You did the right thing, Paul. From what you've told me, Carnby can take care of himself.
The doorbell RINGS.
I'll get it. You stir.
Sarah hands Fischer the wooden spoon. She gives him a qui warm kiss. She exits the room.

Sarah Fischer hurries to the front door. She checks her appearance in a mirror in the Foyer. She touches her hair, purses her lips, and turns to the door. She opens the front door, a pleasant expression on her fa

The lights in the Kitchen start to flicker. Fischer freez listening. The House is quiet. Fischer dives for the revolver hanging in his holster on chair. He pulls a container of glowing bullets out of the pocket of his jacket. The container spills on the floor. He scrambles to pick u the bullets and load them into the revolver. Fischer edges to the Kitchen door, listening, anxious. Everything is quiet. He quietly pushes open the door, revolver ready. 1
Fischer creeps into the Foyer. The lights flicker. No one is in the Foyer. The front door is open.
Sarah? Answer me! Sarah!
No answer. Something CRASHES to the ground in the Living Room.

Fischer quietly opens the door to the Living Room, grippi his revolver tightly. He steps into the room. The lights in the Living Room are out. A broken lamp lies SMASHED on its side. Fischer comes around the side of the couch. He stops, shocked. Sarah Fischer's dead body lies in a pool of blood.

Fischer is suddenly grabbed and SLAMMED into the wall. Th impact knocks several framed photos of Fischer and his Wi off the wall. They SHATTER as they hit the floor. Fischer is PUNCHED in the face, hard. He is stunned. Fischer is hurled over the couch. He lands heavily on a g coffee table, SHATTERING the glass tabletop. The impact knocks his revolver out of his hands. Fischer lies dazed in the broken glass. He looks up at hi attacker. It's Hudgens, standing over him. Hudgens SLAMS his fist into Fischer's face. Fischer is no only semi-conscious. Hudgens pulls out a long, thin spinal-worm. Its many claw feet and razor-sharp jaws snap away, its segmented, scale body writhing in his grip.
If you can't beat us, Fischer, join us.
Hudgens grabs Fischer by his hair and pulls his head back forcing his mouth open.

We follow the spinal-worm as it enters Fischer's mouth, slipping down his throat. We continue to follow the spinal-worm as it makes its way through Fischer's body, weaving through the twists and tu of his digestive system and internal organs. The spinal-worm tears through layers of Fischer's insides finally making its way to his spine. The spinal-worm then wraps itself around Fischer's spine, its tiny clawed feet grabbing hold and attaching themselves along its length. We move up Fischer's spinal cord to his brain. The spinal worm seems to be causing synapses to fire in chaotic burs We travel through Fischer's brain and out of his eyes.
Fischer's expression is now calm. Hudgens regards Fischer looking pleased with himself.
Something chases Young Edward as he runs for his life thr the misty, dark forest. He runs towards a light up ahead.

Young Edward enters the Shed, closing the door behind him The small Shed is cluttered with equipment for repairing power lines. A large transformer module sits at the back the Shed. It HUMS and CRACKLES with electricity. Something compels Young Edward to move closer towards the transformer and reach out a trembling hand. He places his hand against the transformer's front grill. With a sudden SNAP and FLASH, electricity courses through Young Edward. Jagged fingers of blue light jolt around hi

124 It's night. The Loft is dark. Carnby and Aline are fast asleep on the bed, lying next to one another. Carnby wakes up with a start. He tries to get his bearing Carnby looks surprised to see Aline lying next to him. He quietly gets out of bed, letting her sleep. He pulls o fresh shirt. Carnby pads over to the lab area and turns on a desk ligh He sees the wrapped items Aline placed on his work statio Carnby unwraps the items. They are the three Abkani artif from the Museum. Carnby picks up the lynchpin artifact, turning it around. Something catches his eye. Carnby fiddles with the artifa Suddenly, the artifact telescopes out. Instead of one thi ring, it is now three successively smaller rings, one pil on the other, with a common hollow middle.

Carnby picks up the large ring artifact. He slots it into place on the telescoped lynchpin artifact. Next, Carnby s in the medium and small rings into place. The four pieces fit together perfectly, creating a cylindrical device with a small, round opening in the bot 125
Carnby cooks omelettes in the Kitchen area of the Loft. T ingredients are spread out on the counter. Aline wakes up. She sits up in the bed and looks around.
Something smells amazing.
Aline trots over to the Kitchen area as Carnby serves up omelettes. Aline gives him a look.
I love omelettes.
I know.
Carnby sits down across from Aline. They eat while they t
I figured out a connection with the symbols on those artifacts. They correspond to constellations. But something's missing.
Maybe this will help...

Carnby takes out the assembled Abkani device and puts it on the table between them. Aline picks up the device, fascinated. She runs her finge over the Abkani symbols carved into the lynchpin artifact She goes to her bag and pulls out the map she was working and the CD. She hands Carnby the CD.
Can you run the program on this?
Carnby goes over to his computer and inserts the CD.

Aline spreads out the map. She draws lines across it, connecting up constellations with locations on the map. S writes out latitude and longitude calculations. Aline comes up to Carnby at the computer. The program is waiting for her calculations. She leans past Carnby and enters the latitude and longitu numbers into the program. The computer processes the information. Hundreds of map images flash across the scre as the computer searches for a match.
What are we looking for?
The Abkani used constellations to pin- point a geographical location. But I don't think I can isolate it closer than a hundred mile radius.
The computer finds a match. A specific map appears onscre with a 100 mile radius circle marked in the center of it.
Edward...
Yeah. That's us right there.
Carnby points to a spot on the onscreen map.
127 Carnby puts the dishes from their meal into the Kitchen s The sink tap is RUNNING. Aline clears the dishes.

The para-meter Fischer gave Carnby starts faintly BEEPING but the RUNNING sink tap covers the sound. Something is coming. The lights in the Loft flicker once. Carnby turns off the tap and they listen intently. They c hear the scanner BEEPING faintly. The lights in the Loft flicker and go out. Aline grabs the flashlight and switches it on. Carnby runs to his revolver and holster. He checks the chamber in his revolver. The bullets glow. Carnby looks up, sensing something. He spins around, read A FIGURE stands behind him. It is John. John looks fierce, his face drawn, gaunt. His eyes are su into dark recesses, with nearly clear irises.
John?

John lunges at Carnby. Carnby is too surprised to defend himself. John SLAMS Carnby against the wall, knocking his revolver out of his hands. John picks Carnby up and hurls him across the Loft. Carnb CRASHES through furniture as he lands heavily. Out of the shadows behind Aline, two FIGURES emerge. They both missing ORPHANS, one MALE, one FEMALE. They have the same gaunt faces and clear irises as John. Carnby picks himself up. He spots the Orphans behind Alin
Behind you!

The two Orphans lunge at Aline, but she's able to dodge o of the way. The Orphans are fast and fierce. Aline leaps forward, sliding across the floor towards Carnby's revolv She grabs it and spins to face the two Orphans. They're g

But then the Female Orphan leaps out at her. Aline FIRES, hitting the Female Orphan in the shoulder. The Female Orphans jumps away, into the shadows. Aline scrambles to her feet, the revolver ready. But the Female Orphans has disappeared. Aline runs over to Carnby. He grabs a shotgun from the weapons cabinet and loads it.
That looked like John.
It is. The other two are from the orphanage as well.

Carnby pumps the shotgun. Carnby and Aline creep forward the darkness of the Loft. They listen. Suddenly, John lunges at him, his teeth bared. Carnby SMASHES John across the head with the shotgun. But John keeps coming, SLAMMING him against the wall. Carnby breaks John's hold and swivel-kicks him out of the way. J skitters off into the shadows. The Female Orphan leaps out at Aline, trying to tear into with her teeth. Carnby grabs a pipe leaning against the wall and runs for Aline. The Male Orphan lunges out at Carnby. He SMASHES the Male Orphan across the face with the pipe. Aline struggles with the Female Orphan. Carnby turns to s John rising up behind her, about to strike.

arnby reacts instinctively. He FIRES, shooting John in th chest with a shotgun BLAST. John flails back, dead. The Male Orphan jumps out at Carnby. Now working on insti Carnby spins and jams the pipe into his gut, impaling him The Male Orphan stumbles to the ground and dies. Aline gets away from the Female Orphan. As the Female Orp lunges at her again, Aline FIRES, shooting her three time the chest.

But it's only the third bullet, the one that hits the Fem Orphan dead center in the chest that takes her down. The Female Orphan falls back, dead. Aline comes up to Carnby. He stands over John's corpse.
You had no choice.
Something's controlling them.
How many are there altogether?
Twenty. Including me.

The para-meter starts BEEPING again, louder and more frenetic. The lights start to flicker, fading up and down Carnby unzips the duffle-bag. It's full of 713 equipment given to him by Fischer. Carnby loads an assault rifle wi 713 magazines. He loads a pistol with the glowing bullets Carnby throws Aline the pistol. She catches it in mid-air She checks it like a pro. Aline and Carnby stand together, guns drawn, ready. There's a moment of quiet. They listen. The lights in the Loft flicker. The scanner BEEPS. Something SMASHES into the Loft's front door. Carnby grabs the para-meter. It BEEPS more insistently. The front door BURSTS open, knocked right off its hinges the invisible creature crashing through it.
The invisible xenomorph creature's skewed, inhuman P.O.V. it looks across the Loft, searching. It locates Carnby an Aline and heads directly for them.

ll that is visible of the creature's trajectory is furnit being knocked aside as the creature rushes towards them. The creature SMASHES right through a glass-topped work ta SHATTERING it. Papers whirl around in its wake.

Aline and Carnby stand their ground, facing the on-coming creature as it lunges towards them. Carnby and Aline leap out of the way at the last moment. Rolling away in opposite directions, they simultaneously FIRE. Their glowing bullets hit the creature dead on. The creature SQUEALS, flashing visible from the multiple impacts. Their glowing bullets pierce the creature and it tumbles to the ground, dead. The creature's invisible corpse lies motionless. Broken furniture and shattered glass is everywhere. Carnby's para-meter is quiet, the readings subsiding with creature's death. The lights stop flickering.
We'd better get out of here.

Suddenly, all the lights in the Loft go out in unison. Al the computer monitors also go dark. The scanner starts BEEPING frenetically. Electromagnetic readings shoot up, registering multiple sources nearby. Carnby and Aline back up together, ready for an attack.

But the first thing they hear isn't a creature. It's the sound of AUTOMATIC GUNFIRE. Streaks of glowing bullets fly through the air. It is a 713 unit, laying down suppressing FIRE as the Age enter the Loft through the broken front door. Agents Barr, Cheung, and Marko enter, followed by five ot AGENTS. They all wear full 713 combat gear, their rifle- mounted lamps illuminated, their weapons in use.
Carnby located.
Krash monitors the 713 unit from the Control Room. Banks monitors stream data at her. Krash speaks into her head-set comm-link, cool and collec
Multiple readings confirmed. Back-up's on the way.
The Agents FIRE glowing bullets through the dark Loft. Th are invisible creatures everywhere.
Roger that. We're hot.

The muzzle FLASHES and glowing bullets pierce the darknes the Loft. hadows swim through the space as the invisible creatures move around them, attacking the Agents with their razor-s claws and spiked-tails.

An invisible creature swoops out of the shadows towards a Agent, who is FIRING in the opposite direction. The creat whips past the Agent, slicing him open with a fluid slash its claws. The creature keeps moving directly for Carnby. Carnby and Aline, standing together, FIRE their weapons i the darkness, oblivious to the creature rushing towards t
But at the last second, Carnby turns instinctively as the creature lunges at him.
Aline!

Carnby and Aline turn and OPEN FIRE on the creature. It flashes visible from multiple hits, flailing off into the darkness. Agent Barr FIRES controlled bursts of glowing bullets int the dark Loft. He screams into his comm-link.
Where the hell's our back-up?
Landing.
The sound of a HELICOPTER can be heard outside the Loft.

Another invisible creature skirts along the edge of a wal avoiding the GUNFIRE. It locates its target, an Agent FIR up at the ceiling. It races towards the Agent. The Agent turns to the attack and tries to fire. But the creature is too fast. It SLAMS the Agent back against the wall and impales him with its spiked-tail. Agents Barr and Cheung spot this and OPEN FIRE on the creature. It flails about, fading visible from the impact The creature tries to scurry away, but Barr and Cheung ar it. With precision and speed, they blow the creature away But more creatures attack. The fighting is fierce. Glowin bullets streak through the darkness. The Agents are calm determined as they engage the creatures. Carnby and Aline hold their own, sticking together, SHOOT at whatever shadows move around them. Six AGENTS in full combat gear burst into the Loft. Leadi the unit is Commander Burke. Agent Miles is with him, as AGENT TURNER (mid-30s). Burke, Miles, Turner, and the other Agents immediately jo the battle, laying down suppressing FIRE.

An Agent carrying a rifle-mounted grenade-launcher FIRES incendiary flash-grenade at the Upper Level of the Loft. With a flash of blinding light, the grenade EXPLODES. Creatures SQUEAL as flames swoop up through the Upper Lev Glowing bullets fill the dark Loft. Creatures SQUEAL and flail from the hits. In the darkness of the Loft, Carnby, Aline, and the Agent finish off the remaining invisible creatures. The last creature goes down in a hail of glowing bullets. Agents strafe the creature's corpse to make sure it's dea Agent Barr and Carnby exchange a look between them. Barr clearly respects Carnby's abilities. The Loft is still dark. Barr's rifle-mounted scanner no longer registers any creatures.
We're clear, sir.
Burke looks around at the remains of the battle. The Loft totally trashed. A small fire burns in the Upper Level.
Love what you've done with the place, Carnby.
Miles runs a hand-held scanning device over John's corpse The scanner BEEPS, indicating the presence of a spinal-wo
Sir, this one's infected too!
Agent Turner scans the Female Orphan's corpse. His scanni device BEEPS. She has a spinal-worm too.
Got another one here!

Burke immediately turns his weapon to Carnby. The red las sight makes a glowing dot on Carnby's chest. Taking their cue from Burke, the other Agents in his unit train their weapons on Carnby. Several glowing red dots hover on his chest.
Drop your weapon and get down on the ground.
What are you doing?
He's been infected with some kind of organism. He could be under its control.
Aline turns to Carnby.
It's true. I've got one inside me. But it's not controlling me.
You'll excuse me if I don't take your word for it. Now drop your weapon.
Carnby holds his weapon at his side. He doesn't drop it. he doesn't move either. Aline steps in between Carnby and the Agents. The red dot are now trained on her chest.
Get out of the way!
The Agents try to get a clear shot around Aline.
He's not one of them.
If I've got to shoot through you to get to him, I'll do it.
Carnby looks up at the lights. They are still dark.
Why are the lights still out?
Barr consults his scanner. It isn't registering anything.
Scanner's clear.
Krash?
Negative.
Forget to pay your power bill, Carnby?

An Agent standing at the other end of the Loft hears something SHUFFLING behind him. He turns to look. Something grabs the Agent, SLAMS him back against the wal and rips out his neck. It's another ORPHAN, with the same fierce, gaunt look and clear irises. Burke turns away from Carnby for a moment, trying to figu out what's happening. Carnby suddenly lifts his weapon and points it at Burke. Burke sees this, but before he can react, Carnby FIRES. Carnby's bullet WHIZZES past Burke and hits an ORPHAN dea center in the gut, sending him flailing back, dead. The Orphan was about to pounce on Burke. There's a moment as Burke and Carnby look at one another. Burke realizes Carnby just saved his life. The ORPHANS attack. They are the grown-up Children from Carnby's Orphanage. L Pinkerton, they are difficult to kill, immune to pain, fa and deadly. They all have the same gaunt, wild look, with sunken eyes and nearly clear irises. The Orphans leap out at the Agents, quick and fierce. The bite and claw and use their superhuman strength to throw around the Agents and tear them apart. The dark Loft is again lit up with glowing bullets, strea through the darkness. The Agents' rifle-mounted lamps shi around, but the effect is chaotic, disorienting.

As the Orphans attack, they make quick work of many of th Agents. Glowing bullets fly around everywhere. The SCREAM Agents being torn apart mix with BURSTS of AUTOMATIC GUNF Carnby and Aline stay together, dodging the attacking Orphans, and FIRING into the darkness. An Orphan rises up behind Carnby. He spins and SHOOTS her the side. But she just keep coming. Carnby SHOOTS the Orp again, this time dead center in the chest. The Orphan collapses, dead. Carnby checks the corpse. The bullet came out the other s A mixture of red blood and black, sticky ooze drips from bullet hole right over the Orphan's spine. Carnby grabs the comm-link off the body of a dead Agent.
All Agents! You've got to kill the organism to stop them! Aim for the spine!
cross the Loft, Burke listens to the comm-link. An Orphan is attacking Agent Miles. Burke takes careful a and SHOOTS the Orphan in the back, right on the spine. Th Orphan falls over, dead.
Confirmed. Spinal shot's a kill shot.

With this information, the Agents quickly gain the upper- against the Orphans' attack. The Orphans are fast and dea but they have no organization. Now that the Agents have a handle on this new threat, their precision and speed retu Soon, the battle is over. Dozens of bodies of dead Agents dead Orphans lie littered around Carnby's destroyed Loft. Only Carnby, Aline, Burke, Miles, Barr, Cheung, Marko, an Turner remain alive. Burke's and Carnby's eyes meet. Burke approaches Carnby. The other Agents all stand by, waiting for an order from Burke. Aline watches them, ready to step in.
You remember the number one rule they teach you in 713 training? Trust your instincts.
Burke and Carnby face off.
Fischer's missing. So is Hudgens. And I've got a situation brewing that makes this scrap look like a bar brawl.
What does Hudgens have to do with this?
That's what I want to find out. I need you both to brief me in the air.
Burke turns to walk off, but then stops. He turns back to Carnby. Burke holds out his hand.
Oh, and Carnby... I'll need my I-D back.
Carnby smirks. He pulls out Burke's I-D card and hands it back to him.

134 A massive, long-abandoned structure built directly agains the face of a mountain. This is the Entrance Hall of Britannia Mine. 713 AGENTS mill about, setting up perimeter defenses. Hum are being positioned as barricades. Large spotlights are being set up to illuminate the area, with power cables leading inside the Entrance Hall. Agents Barr, Cheung, and Marko are part of the team outsi setting up the defenses. The 713 helicopter carrying Carnby, Aline, Commander Burk and Agents Miles comes down for a landing next to two oth helicopters already sitting in front of the Mine. The moment the helicopter touches down, Burke leaps out, barking into his comm-link. Carnby, Aline, and Miles exit after him.
Krash! What are you reading?
rash swivels in her chair, processing data, making adjustments to sensors, and checking out the information scrolling across the bank of monitors. She wears a head-s
We're practically off the scale, Commander. This is unprecedented. Should I initiate Contingency Nine-Alpha?
The military? We don't have time to wait for them to mobilize.
Is that a negative, Commander?
Burke leads Carnby, Aline, and Miles to the Entrance Hall
No. Initiate Nine-Alpha on my authority. But I won't hold my breath. By the time this clears Defense Council, we'll be dead or drinking...

135 Rusty construction vehicles, detritus, and rubble lie discarded throughout the Hall. Several shafts have been d into the mountain. Narrow paths lead up the slope. AGENTS scurry around, setting up the defense system. The position is set up just inside the entrance to the Hall. Burke and Miles enter, followed by Aline and Carnby.
We've got three perimeters of flash- mines. Gatling guns are set to electromagnetic motion tracking. And every available agent in the vicinity is here. But Commander...
I know, Miles. But back-up won't make it before sunrise.
Several raised Platforms stand in the middle of the Hall. On one Platform, Agent Turner helps two AGENTS unload a l gold-plated generator from the back of a Humvee.
Generator will be on-line shortly, sir.
Burke nods to Turner as he and the others walk by. Carnby Aline get into step with Burke and Miles.
It looks like you're going to war.
We are. The highest xeno concentration on record is closing in on this location. This could be our chance to wipe them out once and for all.
A Tunnel, carved directly into the rock wall of the Mine, leads off into darkness. Carnby stares down at the Tunnel
We need to go down there.
What?
They're coming here for a reason. Until we know what they're after, we're never really going to be able to stop them.
Agent Miles consults his hand-held para-meter.
Something's definitely down there, sir. But there's too much interference to get a clear reading from here.
Miles looks at Burke expectantly. Carnby and Aline watch as well. Burke looks conflicted.
Goddamn it. Miles, you're in charge of perimeter defense. Nothing gets in or out until we find out what's down there.

Batteries of flash-mines (mines that explode with a burst blinding light) set to electromagnetic sensors are being positioned in wide perimeters around the Entrance Hall. Automatic gatling guns loaded with chains of glowing bull are set up at key points around the area. The gatling gun are mounted on swiveling robotic bases, able to automatic turn to face on-coming targets. AGENT FEENSTRA (mid-30s) tests the motion sensor on one o the gatling guns with her hand. The gun swivels accuratel match the movement of her hand. Agent Feenstra nods to the two AGENTS standing behind the gatling gun. They tinker with its guidance system.

37 Carnby and Aline walk carefully down a pitch black tunnel illuminated only by their lights. Along with them are Commander Burke, and Agents Barr, Che and Marko. They each carry assault rifles with lamps moun on them. Their visors are down.
I've been thinking about something. The Abkani prophecy. The shadows that make ghosts of men...
Every culture has a story about the end of the world.
But not every story starts to come true.
Agent Barr carries a hand-held para-meter. It's picking u high electromagnetic readings.
It's definitely this way, sir.
They pass by various pieces of mining equipment, long sin discarded. Thick dust and cobwebs hang off the equipment. They make their way down the Tunnel.

head_text.subj: SCENES 141 AND 142 INCORPORATED IN SCENES 134 AND 135

text: 144 The Tunnel ends at a slightly larger, rounded Chamber wit walls of solid rock. They can't go any further. Cobwebs a thick dust hang everywhere. Carnby, Aline, Burke, Barr, Cheung, and Marko emerge out the Tunnel into the Chamber.
It's a dead end.
Agent Barr checks his para-meter.
Readings are getting stronger.
Carnby looks around, sensing something. He wipes away som cobwebs and dust and runs his hand over the Chamber walls
We'll double-back. Take another tunnel.
Wait. Aline, look at this...
Aline approaches the spot where Carnby stands. She shines flashlight beam in the wiped off area. Faint Abkani symbo are carved into the wall.
They're Abkani.

The Agents all start wiping away the cobwebs and dust, examining the walls for more symbols. They all shine thei beams of light through the dark space, searching. Cheung finds more Abkani symbols on another wall.
There's more over here.

As Agent Marko moves through the space with his lamp, his boot hits a small protrusion in the dusty ground. Agent M shines his lamp down on ground. With his boot, he pushes the dust on the ground. There's a carving on the floor. Agent Barr spots Marko and shines his lamp towards him.
What do you got, Marko?

Agent Marko presses down on the carving with his boot. Suddenly, the stone floor beneath Agent Marko crumbles aw revealing a deep circular Shaft. Agent Marko can't hold on and he falls into the Shaft. He SCREAMS as he falls.
Marko!

The Shaft drops down sixty feet. Marko falls, unable to s his descent. The Shaft walls are rough-hewn rock. Small fingers of lic grow out of the cracks in the stone. An ancient, fragile wooden ladder is imbedded directly into the rock wall, it rungs made of thick, knotted old branches.
145 The Shaft drops into a round, sand-covered room. Razor-sh spikes poke out of the loose sand beneath the Shaft. Agent Marko falls directly onto the spikes. He is impaled them. 1
46 The others rush to the lip of the Shaft. They can barely the illumination of Marko's flashlight in the depths belo
We've got to get down there.
Agent Miles surveys the defense position inside the Hall. spotlights aren't on yet.
Defense perimeter's up. Still waiting for the generator to come on-line.
We're retrieving Marko. Keep me posted.

Agent Feenstra checks her rifle, loading in a fresh magaz She looks a little nervous, having trouble getting it to Miles gently takes the rifle from Feenstra. He SLAMS the magazine in and checks the rifle. He hands it back.
How long do we have to hold them?
Only until dawn.
Sir... that's four hours away.
I know.
n the side of a mountain rising up over Britannia Mine, Hudgens and Fischer stand watching the activity below.

Jagged bolts of lightning and RUMBLING THUNDER echo aroun them. The sound of HISSING comes up around them. Suddenly, one by one, creatures start fading into visibil behind them. More and more creatures appear, fading visib until there are dozens of xenomorph creatures stretching the mountain-side. Hudgens looks back at his creature army. He lets an evil smile slip across his face. All at once, the creatures start leaping down the mountainside. As they run, they all start fading invisibl
